Package com.kicas.rp.event

Class PlayerEventHandler

java.lang.Object
com.kicas.rp.event.PlayerEventHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public class PlayerEventHandler extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
Handle events caused by players.

    • onPlayerInteract

      public void onPlayerInteract(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEvent event)
      Handles multiple different types of block interactions as detailed below. Left click block:
      • Fire extinguishing
      • Punching of a dragon egg (causing it to teleport)
      Right click block:
      • Chest opening
      • The placing of "placeables" such as boats, armor stands, etc.
      • The opening of inventory holders, or blocks that contain items.
      • Interactions with blocks that cause a permanent or semi-permanent state change.
      Physical:
      • The breaking of turtle eggs and farmland by jumping on them.
      • The activation of pressure plates and tripwires.
      Parameters:
      event - the event.

    • onPlayerInteractEntity

      public void onPlayerInteractEntity(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEntityEvent event)
      Handles multiple different types of entity interactions as detailed below.
      • The breaking of leash hitches by right-clicking it.
      • The usage of name tags on entities
      • The accessing of inventory holder entities such as minecart chests.
      • The accessing of interactable entities such as trader entities.
      Parameters:
      event - the event.

    • onLecternBookTaken

      Prevent players from taking lectern books unless they have container trust and above.
      Parameters:
      event - the event.

    • onPlayerJoin

      public void onPlayerJoin(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent event)
      Grants the player permission to fly if they log into a region where the flight flag is set to true. Changes the player's gamemode if they log into a region with the entry-gamemode flag
      Parameters:
      event - the event.

      Handle the deny-command flag. Cancels `/trigger as_trigger...` command when targeting an armour stand
      Parameters:
      event - the event.
